meanings.definition: The act of correcting or making right.
meanings.sent1: The rectification of the mistake brought peace to the situation.
meanings.sent2: She always seeks rectification when she realizes she has made an error.
meanings.sent3: The rectification of the upside-down painting made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His apology was a rectification that healed their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The rectification of the broken vase was done with care and precision.

meanings.definition: The process of purifying or refining something.
meanings.sent1: The rectification of impurities in the water made it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The rectification of the recipe resulted in a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The rectification of the muddy puddle turned it into a crystal-clear pool.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a rectification that purified their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The rectification of the silver made it shine like new.

meanings.definition: The conversion of alternating current to direct current.
meanings.sent1: The rectification of the electricity allowed the device to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The rectification of the power source was necessary for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The rectification of the electrical signal made the light bulb dance.
meanings.sent4: The rectification of the energy flow transformed the entire system.
meanings.sent5: The rectification of the current improved the efficiency of the machine.
